The police have 72 vacancies
By the end of 2019, the police will have 72 vacancies. At the same time, NOK 100 million on the budget will not be charged until after the New Year.
06 Nov 2019, 18:31 by NTB
This is shown by the Police Directorate's second tertiary report, which ABC News has gained access to. The report also shows that the police districts steer against the fact that 72 vacant positions will be vacant at the end of 2019.
Department Director Kristin Kvigne in the Directorate writes in an email to ABC News that the number of vacancies is likely to be somewhat lower by the end of the year, but acknowledges that some police districts are lagging behind in staffing.


üì∑ Pedersen, Terje / NTB scanpix

- Estimated less consumption in the Police Directorate is largely due to expected displacements in committed funds from this year to 2020. We cannot spend the money more than once, so these are not funds that can be used for new hires, Kvigne writes.
In practice, this means that this is money that has already been spent and must not be misunderstood as money left over, the Police Directorate points out to NTB,
At the same time, the report states that the number of pending cases is increasing. Kvigne writes that the police have seen a significant change in the crime scene, where traditional crime of crime goes down and categories such as abuse in close relationships and sexual abuse go up.
- It is right to prioritize these, but it challenges us on capacity. We use 34 percent of the exploration capacity on 2.9 percent of the most serious cases, she writes.
